Zhent08_AD.synopsis: Karad is standing around on guard duty, bored.

Zhent02_CaughtUp.synopsis: The player has snuck into the miiddle of a Zhentarim outpost and been spotted - the Zhent would usually run but choose to fight as the player got too close before discovery. In some cases, friendly members of the group recognise the player.

DoubtingArtist_Dead.synopsis: An artist captued by the Zhentarim, Oskar was being forced to paint against his will while the Zhentarim arranged to ransom him back to his patron in BG.

Zhent03_AD_Idle.synopsis: Brem is chatting to himself as he packs to leave the Zhent hideout.

Zhent04_AD_Idle.synopsis: Garias is talking to his brother as they prepare to leave their secret gang hideout.

AD_InvestigationCheck.synopsis: Player is chasing someone down into a seemingly sealed room - they'll either realise there's another door or just be confused that their quarry has disappeared.

Zhent05_AD_Idle.synopsis: Bellar is a cheerfully violent thug who is happily chatting to himself while his companions prepare to flee their hideout.

Zhent02_AD_Idle.synopsis: Zarys is barking orders at her minions as they prepare to leave the hideout.

Zhent02_Stage1.synopsis:
Zarys is standing on a raised platform just as we stumble into her secret outpost, speaking to us across a gap of about 15 feet. We have to convince her we're friendly or she's ready to have us killed.

Her gang are preparing to burn down their hideout when they leave, and in some cases she'll give the order to start that process if she thinks we're a threat.

Zhent06.synopsis: Jarg is a veteran of the crime organisation - as friendly as they come but would plant an arrow between your eyes without thinking twice.

Dog_01.synopsis: Younger dog is following her master on patrol duty, mindful of all the beastly scents in the underdark.

DoubtingArtist.synopsis:
An artist captued by the Zhentarim, Oskar is being forced to paint against his will. He'll discreetly approach the player and beg them to buy him, mindful that he's within earshot of his brutal captors. 
If he is freed by whatever means, he'll regain some of his old haughtiness but will ultimately still be grateful as he relates his story - that he's torn between two loves. The first is the patron who has offered to marry him, and the second is a first true love from his pre-fame and -wealth past.

Zhent02_AD_Stage2.synopsis: Zarys is pulling her troops back as we intrude on their hideout

Zhent01.synopsis: Salazon is a guard the player will have encountered on entering the dungeon he'll either have fled from us, tried to blow us up, or let us pass.

Zhents_AD_ZhentAgentEscape.synopsis: The player has freed a Zhent prisoner - tied up and beaten because he failed to return to the hideout with a valuable shipment. The NPC sees the prisoner freed and running for the exit.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_OllyDead.synopsis: Back and forth between Rugan and Zarys if Olly died before reaching the hideout.

DoubtingArtist_AD_WarnAboutExplosives.synopsis: The doubting artist warns the player about the explosives inside the Zhent dungeon

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.synopsis: Back and forth between Olly, Zarys and Rugan in their idle states .

Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.synopsis: One-shot combat AD to play when the character uses a Poison Vail.

Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics.synopsis: Brem is commenting on paintings by the doubting artist.

Zhent02_AD_CaughtUp.synopsis: Zarys is fleeing while hideout crumbles around her, player pursues.

VB_Entrance.synopsis: Player exclaims on entering a hidden underground cave.

Zhent04_AD_Welcome.synopsis: Garias is guarding a lowly gang hideout. ADs as he approaches you to open the door.

Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.synopsis: One-shot combat AD to play when the character uses a Poison Vail.

Zhent06_AD.synopsis: Jarg is a veteran of the Zhent - but he's on guard duty and he's bored.

Dog_03.synopsis: This dog is guarding an illusory wall. It looks solid to him (and the player), but he can't smell it.

Zhent03.synopsis: Brem is a trader for the Zhentarim. When we meet him, he's holding an artist prisoner and offering us a portrait. We can persuade him to release the prisoner or just buy him outright - or just trade normally. He'll indicate that there are more illicit items he can show us - once we prove ourselves to his leader.

Zhent07_AD_Combat.synopsis: One-shot combat AD to play when the zhent is taking her turn.

AD_UseLift.synopsis: On interacting with a broken elevator.

Zhent06_AD_Combat.synopsis: One-shot combat AD to play when the zhent is taking his turn.

Zhent02.synopsis: Zarys has allowed the player to enter the Zhentarim hideout - either because we won her trust or she needs our help finding her missing agents.

Zhent02_Trap.synopsis: We walk in to find Zarys overseeing the torture of an agent that handed over special cargo to us. The agent is currently bound to a chair and badly beaten, and we're due to get the same treatment in her eyes - unless we can talk her out of it.Volume is likely louder than normal conversation but not shouting - she's standing on a raised platform perhaps ten feet above us and the tortured agent,

Dog_02.synopsis: This older dog is following his master on guard duty, uncomprehending the endless circles they walk but happy to do it anyway.

PAD_NoticedFakeWall.synopsis: In exploring the zhent dungeon, the player has discovered an illusory wall.

Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.synopsis: One-shot combat AD to play when the character uses a Poison Vail.

Zhent07_AD.synopsis: Vol is guarding a storeroom down in a cave and is very bored.

Zhent05_AD_Combat_LeaderDied.synopsis: One-shot combat AD to play when the leader of the Zhentarim - Zarys, - dies.

Zhent02_Dead.synopsis: A SwD with Zarys, the Zhentarim leader. She can tell us about the situation in the outpost, and the missing agents and cargo she's waiting for.

Zhent02_Stage2.synopsis: Zarys is fleeing the player, setting traps as she goes (ADs account for if she is unable to do so)

Zhent03_AD_Zhent04.synopsis: Brem and Garias are brothers, ADing back and forth about the artist they've taken captive (or sold)

DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering.synopsis: Doubting artist is cowering because something potentially harmfull is happening. He don't want to talk until it is resolved.

Zhent05.synopsis: Bellar is a common thug working for the Zhent. We can find him beating one of their own members for incompetence, or waiting to flee the hideout.

Zhent02_AD_Stage1Darkness.synopsis: Zarys is responding to the player trying to creep up on her crew, based on whether we've met her before or not.

Zhent07_AD_TrapsActivated.synopsis: Plays if the player sets off the explosives after winning the Zhent over.

VB_Cellar.synopsis: Player has descended into a hideout and the person they're chasing has disappeared.

AD_InvestigationCheck2.synopsis: Player passes investigation check to discover hidden door, but it's locked.

PAD_HiddenEntrance_Opened.synopsis: Player has opened a secret entrance hidden behind an elaborate sliding-wardrobe setup.

DoubtingArtist_AD_Idle.synopsis: Doubting artist has been kidnapped and is now enslaved by Zhentarim. Everything is peaceful around, for now.

Zhent08.synopsis: Karad is bored, guarding the back of the cave.

Zhent01_AD_Idle.synopsis: Salazon is pacing, packing up ahead of the plan to blow the hideout.

Zhent04.synopsis: Garias is a lowly Zhent recruit left with guarding the gate. He's sullen about it.

Zhent02_Stage3.synopsis: Zarys is fleeing while her hideout blows up around her. Player is pursuing.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: After examining the dialogue sessions and their synopses, we identified several clusters of events that must occur in a particular order. For example, early on the player encounters Zarys in a staged introduction (Zhent02_Stage1), which then leads to her granting entry to the hideout (Zhent02). Once inside the hideout further events occur – Zarys pulling her troops back (Zhent02_AD_Stage2) may then be followed by scenes where she retreats (Zhent02_AD_CaughtUp or Zhent02_Stage3) and eventually, if things deteriorate, she dies (Zhent02_Dead). In addition, the Doubting Artist has alternative arcs – one in which he is freed (triggering his dialogue about explosives) and one in which he is dead. This gives rise to a mutual exclusivity between DoubtingArtist and DoubtingArtist_Dead. A similar exclusive choice exists between the agent shipment sessions: if Olly dies, AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_OllyDead is triggered; otherwise AD_ZhentShipmentAgents takes place. In other clusters, we can establish order relations for Zhent03 and Zhent04 when they discuss the captive artist (Zhent03_AD_Zhent04), for Zhent06 and Zhent07 whose base encounters are followed by ambience and combat one-shot ADs, and for minor environmental clues – for example, the player first notices a fake wall (PAD_NoticedFakeWall) then later triggers its opening (PAD_HiddenEntrance_Opened). A further instance is the investigation check sequence where the first check (AD_InvestigationCheck) is followed by the door discovery (AD_InvestigationCheck2). Only sessions with such logical ordering or mutually exclusive conditions are included in the output.

Zhent08_AD_1.speaker: Karad
Zhent08_AD_1.text: Hells with this - I was promised steady coin, not some stlarning cave.

Zhent08_AD_3.speaker: Karad
Zhent08_AD_3.text: I can't wait to get back to the city. I'm bloody horny.

Zhent02_CaughtUp_4.speaker: Rugan
Zhent02_CaughtUp_4.text: What did you have to come creeping in for? Sorry - we'll make this quick.

Zhent02_CaughtUp_2.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_CaughtUp_2.text: No prisoners! No mercy! Take them!

DoubtingArtist_Dead_20.speaker: Narrator
DoubtingArtist_Dead_20.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

DoubtingArtist_Dead_17.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_Dead_17.text: You do know you're not alive anymore, right?

DoubtingArtist_Dead_14.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_Dead_14.text: Where did you keep your valuables?

DoubtingArtist_Dead_27.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_Dead_27.text: ...These hands... this mind... treasure enough for a king...

DoubtingArtist_Dead_18.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_Dead_18.text: ... Baldur's Gate... Lady Jannath's own court...

DoubtingArtist_Dead_2.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_Dead_2.text: What were you doing down here?

DoubtingArtist_Dead_1.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_Dead_1.text: Who were you meant to marry?

DoubtingArtist_Dead_8.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_Dead_8.text: ... patron... Lady Jannath... but... love another...

DoubtingArtist_Dead_5.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_Dead_5.text: ... Zhentarim hideout... sweaty and stinking... just like them...

DoubtingArtist_Dead_4.speaker: Narrator
DoubtingArtist_Dead_4.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

DoubtingArtist_Dead_25.speaker: Narrator
DoubtingArtist_Dead_25.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

DoubtingArtist_Dead_26.speaker: Narrator
DoubtingArtist_Dead_26.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

Zhent07_0.speaker: Vol
Zhent07_0.text: Didn't I tell you to move along?

Zhent07_1.speaker: Vol
Zhent07_1.text: Nothing to see here. Move along.

Zhent03_AD_Idle_0.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle_0.text: Hope we don't wake anything down there.

Zhent03_AD_Idle_1.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle_1.text: Stlarning smokepowder smells like arse. Dead arse.

Zhent03_AD_Idle_3.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle_3.text: This ain't mine. This ain't mine either. Or that... well, in my bag. Mine now.

Zhent03_AD_Idle_4.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle_4.text: Well, won't get that letter sent this side of the Underdark.

Zhent03_AD_Idle_5.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle_5.text: 'Dear mother - saw my first gibbering mouther, and sorry I ever compared you.'

Zhent03_AD_Idle_2.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle_2.text: 'At least the mouther had to stop for breath.'

Zhent04_AD_Idle_0.speaker: Garias
Zhent04_AD_Idle_0.text: Wonder if the Fist pay better than this lot...

Zhent04_AD_Idle_1.speaker: Garias
Zhent04_AD_Idle_1.text: I was told there'd be battles. Not this hide-and-seek stuff.

Zhent04_AD_Idle_2.speaker: Garias
Zhent04_AD_Idle_2.text: Are we unpacking? I thought we was packing.

Zhent04_AD_Idle_3.speaker: Garias
Zhent04_AD_Idle_3.text: Hope the Fist tries to storm in. I want to see those traps in action.

AD_InvestigationCheck_0.speaker: Player
AD_InvestigationCheck_0.text: There's a breeze down here. Wonder where it's coming from.

Zhent05_AD_Idle_0.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Idle_0.text: Thought I was paid to crack heads, not stack bloody boxes.

Zhent05_AD_Idle_1.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Idle_1.text: Reckon I might actually miss this place.

Zhent05_AD_Idle_2.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Idle_2.text: Belt-knife, check. Boot-knife, check. Jock-kni - argh! Helm's hanging orbs, that hurt.

Zhent05_AD_Idle_3.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Idle_3.text: Don't know why we don't just kill those Fist.

Zhent02_AD_Idle_0.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Idle_0.text: Lamps, lads - sealed lamps! Don't want open flames where we're going.

Zhent02_AD_Idle_3.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Idle_3.text: Any falls behind, I leave them for the Fist! And in no state to tell tales.

Zhent02_Stage1_31.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_31.text: Well - it seems you were telling the truth.

Zhent02_Stage1_85.speaker: Rugan
Zhent02_Stage1_85.text: That's the one who saved me, Zarys!

Zhent02_Stage1_27.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_27.text: More importantly, that's the one who saved the cargo, Rugan.

Zhent02_Stage1_124.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_124.text: You did us a good turn, and the Zhentarim pay their debts.

Zhent02_Stage1_66.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_66.text: Seems I recall telling you not to come back without my people.
Zhent02_Stage1_66.context: NodeContext: As if she's just remembering something idly - but with a hard edge.

Zhent02_Stage1_95.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_95.context: NodeContext: Hard edge - she told us to find her agents and we haven't done it yet.

Zhent02_Stage1_77.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_77.text: That's far enough. What's your business down here? Answer honestly, and maybe we'll kill you clean.
Zhent02_Stage1_77.context: NodeContext: Neutral but firm - she's not remotely afraid of us but

Zhent02_Stage1_109.speaker: Rugan
Zhent02_Stage1_109.text: Hold on. That's the one who saved us from the gnolls. Let them in.
Zhent02_Stage1_109.context: NodeContext: Interjecting - his boss is about to attack us, but he recognises us as the group that saved him

Zhent02_Stage1_146.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_146.text: You revealed our location? That tongue gets any looser, Rugan, I'll cut it out.
Zhent02_Stage1_146.context: NodeContext: Turning to speak to Rugan, who is right beside her. Hard edge - he gave up a secret location to people he didn't even know. When Zarys make threats, there's no bluster, just simple statement of fact.

Zhent02_Stage1_32.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_32.text: Come down, then. Seems you're a friend of the family.
Zhent02_Stage1_32.context: NodeContext: Letting us in, relenting that we helped her gang out but also keen to get back to her own business.

Zhent02_Stage1_73.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_73.text: Whoa, hold your arrows! This is Rugan's saviour, I'll bet. He told us all about you.
Zhent02_Stage1_73.context: NodeContext: Hurriedly belaying her threat, realising who were are and turning suddenly friendly. Unbeknownst to us, an agent of hers gave up our description under torture, and she's luring us into a trap.

Zhent02_Stage1_143.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_143.text: Come on in, then. Any friend of Rugan's is a friend of the family.
Zhent02_Stage1_143.context: NodeContext: Friendly -  she's luring us into a trap.

Zhent02_Stage1_25.context: NodeContext: Almost bored but with a hard edge - we've blundered in and she has more important matters to deal with, just wants rid of us.

Zhent02_Stage1_34.context: NodeContext: Almost bored but with a hard edge - we've blundered in and she has more important matters to deal with, just wants rid of us.

Zhent02_Stage1_76.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1_76.text: Your lookout already tried - and failed.

Zhent02_Stage1_145.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_145.text: I won't. Last time - what's your business here?
Zhent02_Stage1_145.context: NodeContext: Blunt - we're wasting her time and she's ready to kill us.

Zhent02_Stage1_50.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1_50.text: Relax - your guard at the door let me in.

Zhent02_Stage1_120.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_120.text: Then your answer decides his fate as well as your own - so make it good.
Zhent02_Stage1_120.context: NodeContext: The fact that her guard let us in doesn't move her in the slightest - she's still ready to kill us.

Zhent02_Stage1_72.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1_72.text: I know the pass-phrase: 'Little serpent, long shadow'.

Zhent02_Stage1_105.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_105.text: That just tells me you know our codes, not why you're here. I won't ask again.
Zhent02_Stage1_105.context: NodeContext: Losing patience and dismissing our attempts to use her passphrase - we could have learned that anywhere and it doesn't answer her question.

Zhent02_Stage1_67.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1_67.text: Your colleague gave me a pass-phrase: 'Little serpent, long shadow'.

Zhent02_Stage1_119.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_119.text: That just tells me you've met my people - not why you're here in their stead.
Zhent02_Stage1_119.context: NodeContext: Losing patience and dismissing our attempts to use her passphrase - we could have learned that anywhere and it doesn't answer her question.

Zhent02_Stage1_82.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1_82.text: I saved them on the road. They'll be along soon.

Zhent02_Stage1_46.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1_46.text: I saved Rugan on the road. He'll be along soon.

Zhent02_Stage1_106.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_106.text: Then I'll welcome you as a friend - if and when they get here.
Zhent02_Stage1_106.context: NodeContext: To the point - we may be truthful when we say we're a friend, but she's waiting on evidence of it.

Zhent02_Stage1_127.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_127.text: Until then, I suggest you keep your distance.

Zhent02_Stage1_18.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_18.text: Hrast. Then you're the least of my problems. Count your blessings - and bugger off.

Zhent02_Stage1_0.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1_0.text: They won't be coming back - but I know what became of their cargo.

Zhent02_Stage1_90.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_90.text: Really? That information would be worth quite a bit to me. If you're telling the truth.
Zhent02_Stage1_90.context: NodeContext: Reassessing us - we've said the right thing to get inside, but she doesn't trust us and is making the clear.

Zhent02_Stage1_64.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1_64.text: Fear not, you can trust me. Your friends did.

Zhent02_Stage1_142.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1_142.text: Your colleague gave me a pass-phrase: 'Little serpent, long shadow'.

Zhent02_Stage1_129.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_129.text: Hrast - lads, we've got a visitor! Arm the traps!
Zhent02_Stage1_129.context: NodeContext: 'Hrast' is a harsh curse where she comes from - you've just disappeared before her eyes and she's warning her men to get ready for a fight.

Zhent02_Stage1_49.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_49.text: Hrast - lads, we've got a visitor! Arm yourselves!
Zhent02_Stage1_49.context: NodeContext: 'Hrast' is a harsh curse where she comes from - you've just disappeared before her eyes and she's warning her men to get ready for a fight.

Zhent02_Stage1_112.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_112.text: You know I can still see you, right?
Zhent02_Stage1_112.context: NodeContext: As if speaking to an idiot - we just tried and failed to disappear from her review.

Zhent02_Stage1_92.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1_92.text: I'm coming in. If you want to die over it, that's your business.

Zhent02_Stage1_8.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_8.text: Well aren't you a cold one - making threats like you can back 'em up.
Zhent02_Stage1_8.context: NodeContext: Reassessing us, mocking but also vaguely impressed that we're ready to fight her and all her men.

Zhent02_Stage1_2.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_2.text: Perhaps you are more useful to me alive.
Zhent02_Stage1_2.context: NodeContext: Considering you - you had the gall to try and intimidate your way into a base of armed soldiers, and she has a job for someone like that

Zhent02_Stage1_70.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_70.text: Keep coming - see who it is gets buried down here.

Zhent02_Stage1_100.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1_100.text: I'm coming in. If you want to die over it, that's your business.

Zhent02_Stage1_113.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1_113.text: LET ME IN. OR DIE. CHOOSE.

Zhent02_Stage1_102.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1_102.text: I want you to know the face of your killer. Or you can let me in.

Zhent02_Stage1_91.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1_91.text: I truly don't want to fight - just to trade.

Zhent02_Stage1_3.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1_3.text: Try and I will take your skulls as trophies.

Zhent02_Stage1_138.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_138.context: NodeContext: Initally a bit scared, then recovers composure

Zhent02_Stage1_57.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_57.context: NodeContext: Slightly bemused at the strange roar

Zhent02_Stage1_15.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1_15.text: Stand down. I go where I please.

Zhent02_Stage1_41.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_41.context: NodeContext: Blunt, unimpressed - this is her domain.

Zhent02_Stage1_58.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_58.text: Still... takes steel to swagger in here. If you're half as tough as you think you are, I might have a job for you.
Zhent02_Stage1_58.context: NodeContext: Considering you - you had the gall to try and intimidate your way into a base of armed soldiers, and she has a job for someone like that

Zhent02_Stage1_98.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1_98.text: I don't want trouble - I just want to trade.

Zhent02_Stage1_22.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_22.text: Trade with what? Your life was ours the moment you walked in here.
Zhent02_Stage1_22.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed - our life is in her hands, and she's stating it as a simple matter of fact.

Zhent02_Stage1_75.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_75.text: But... maybe I'll let you buy it back. I have a job needs doing.
Zhent02_Stage1_75.context: NodeContext: Considering us - normally she'd kill us but we just tried to talk our way into her base, and she could use skills like that.

Zhent02_Stage1_148.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_148.text: We've disarmed the traps. Come down.
Zhent02_Stage1_148.context: NodeContext: An order, not a request - we're entirely in her power as far as she's concerned.

Zhent02_Stage1_16.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_16.text: I don't feel like trading today.
Zhent02_Stage1_16.context: NodeContext: Blunt, not to be dissuaded - she has no interest in speaking to us.

Zhent02_Stage1_84.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_84.text: I suggest you turn around - we're closing the shop for the day.
Zhent02_Stage1_84.context: NodeContext: A threat under the guise of friendly advice.

Zhent02_Stage1_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Zhentarim goes and activates the traps.|

Zhent02_Stage1_94.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_94.text: I don't feel like trading today.
Zhent02_Stage1_94.context: NodeContext: Blunt, not to be dissuaded - she has no interest in speaking to us.

Zhent02_Stage1_111.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_111.text: I suggest you turn around - we're closing the shop for the day.
Zhent02_Stage1_111.context: NodeContext: A threat under the guise of friendly advice.

Zhent02_Stage1_19.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_19.text: Where in the hells is Rugan. I need that cargo.
Zhent02_Stage1_19.context: NodeContext: Frustrated - she's waiting on her agent and his cargo, We're reading her thoughts here, so can be more angry/concerned than the cool exterior she presents

Zhent02_Stage1_117.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1_117.text: I know what became of Rugan. His cargo, too.

Zhent02_Stage1_108.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_108.text: I never mentioned any cargo, and I don't care for people poking around in my head.
Zhent02_Stage1_108.context: NodeContext: Initially taken aback but barely missing a beat as she realises you must have cast a spell in her. Chiding with a hard edge.

Zhent02_Stage1_43.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_43.text: Still, I can look past it - if you have what I need. Come down.
Zhent02_Stage1_43.context: NodeContext: Shrugging your offence off because she's all about business - but second line is a threat. Her mercy is conditional on your usefulness.

Zhent02_Stage1_29.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1_29.text: I'm here to help you find your missing cargo.

Zhent02_Stage1_133.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_133.text: I never mentioned any cargo, and I don't care for people poking around in my head.
Zhent02_Stage1_133.context: NodeContext: Initially taken aback but barely missing a beat as she realises you must have cast a spell in her. Chiding with a hard edge.

Zhent02_Stage1_89.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_89.text: Though it was subtly done, I'll grant you that. Maybe I can use you.
Zhent02_Stage1_89.context: NodeContext: Grudging respect, reassessing you and your usefulness

Zhent02_Stage1_134.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_134.context: NodeContext: Irritated beyond disbelief that you'd try and read her thoughts - ready to kill you.

Zhent02_Stage1_71.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_71.text: Here's a thought for you - turn around.
Zhent02_Stage1_71.context: NodeContext: She caught us trying to read her mind and is giving us a last warning

Zhent02_Stage1_144.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1_144.text: I've a network of dangerous contacts who know I'm here. Kill me, they come for you.

Zhent02_Stage1_80.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1_80.text: A child of Gith goes where they please.

Zhent02_Stage1_38.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_38.text: I've heard stories about your kind. Stay where you are.
Zhent02_Stage1_38.context: NodeContext: Considering you - you've told her you're from a famed and savage warrior race, and she's not interested in having that kind of chaos around

Zhent02_Stage1_39.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_39.text: If breathing pleases you, you'd best turn around.
Zhent02_Stage1_39.context: NodeContext: She's absolutely disinterested in what 'pleases' you - she wants you out.

Zhent02_Stage1_51.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1_51.text: A child of Gith goes where they please.

Zhent02_Stage1_10.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_10.text: A planeswalker? I've heard stories about your kind.
Zhent02_Stage1_10.context: NodeContext: Considering you - you're a famed warrior race that she thought a myth until this very moment. Vaguely surprised, but only vaguely - she's unflappable

Zhent02_Stage1_7.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_7.text: If half of them are true, you might be more useful alive.
Zhent02_Stage1_7.context: NodeContext: She's heard legends of your race and their fighting ability, and is immediately thinking on how she can use you

Zhent02_Stage1_114.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_114.text: You're ugly enough - no need to be a liar on top. Now toddle off back to whatever hole you came from.
Zhent02_Stage1_114.context: NodeContext: Considering you - you've told her you're from a famed and savage warrior race, and she's not interested in having that kind of chaos around

Zhent02_Stage1_1.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1_1.text: I thought the Zhentarim would honour a fellow Banite.

Zhent02_Stage1_115.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_115.text: You're a priest of the Black Hand?

Zhent02_Stage1_87.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_87.text: 'Fellow Banite' might be a bit strong, but you're welcome among the Zhent.
Zhent02_Stage1_87.context: NodeContext: She's alluding to the religious roots your organisations share, but hers have left behind. Still respectul/

Zhent02_Stage1_121.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1_121.text: Might be I have use for someone with your skills.

Zhent06_0.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06_0.text: Wanna pick out the true Zhent? Tell 'em they're going down into the Underdark.

Zhent06_1.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06_1.text: While everyone else is bawling, they'll be the ones asking about hazard pay.

Zhent06_2.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06_2.text: Had a peach of a shot on you as you came in.

Dog_01_1.speaker: Indra
Dog_01_1.text: The dark smells wrong. Not night-dark. Waiting-dark.

Dog_01_2.speaker: Indra
Dog_01_2.text: Have to stay with master. Keep master from the dark.

DoubtingArtist_12.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_12.text: I rather suspected I'd die in a sunless hole. Just not this one.

DoubtingArtist_13.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_13.context: NodeContext: Polited but panicked - he's a hostage and by talking to him, we risk making his captors angry

DoubtingArtist_81.speaker: Garias
DoubtingArtist_81.text: Oi! Leave him be, yeah? You've got an appointment with Zarys - and she don't like waiting.

DoubtingArtist_69.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_69.text: I'm far too busy to speak. Goodbye!
DoubtingArtist_69.context: NodeContext: Pretending all is well, really trying to get rid of us

DoubtingArtist_141.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_141.text: Why do you think I'm going to die?

DoubtingArtist_42.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_42.context: NodeContext: Shocked that we know what he was thinking

DoubtingArtist_198.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_198.text: Look, whatever you planned with Rugan, they know. Be ready for anything.
DoubtingArtist_198.context: NodeContext: Hushed tones - he's giving us a warning and trying not to get caught

DoubtingArtist_151.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_151.text: Discern the source of his unease.

DoubtingArtist_78.speaker: Narrator
DoubtingArtist_78.text: *His eyes are glassy, and he is sweating profusely - absolutely terrified, but pretending all is well.*

DoubtingArtist_184.speaker: Narrator
DoubtingArtist_184.text: *There's little to discern- aside from his obvious desire to be left alone.*

DoubtingArtist_97.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_97.text: Relax. I'm just here to trade.

DoubtingArtist_70.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_70.text: No, not trade - trap. Prove you're more useful alive.
DoubtingArtist_70.context: NodeContext: Hushed through gritted teeth and a fixed smile - he's trying to warn you without getting caught

DoubtingArtist_110.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_110.text: Quite. Now I really do have to get back to work!
DoubtingArtist_110.context: NodeContext: Nodding along, panicked, loud, and clearly not listening. Just wants us to move on.

DoubtingArtist_107.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_107.context: NodeContext: Repeated in a hushed panic - what's going on underneath the surface as he tries to pretend you're not walking into a trap.

DoubtingArtist_23.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_23.text: It's pure savagery, to keep a prisoner parched like this. They'll only offer me water.

DoubtingArtist_146.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_146.text: Your jailor is dead - you're free to go.

DoubtingArtist_75.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_75.text: He's what? Pardon... I won't miss him. But Brem was about as reasonable as these thugs get.
DoubtingArtist_75.context: NodeContext: First part a dismayed outburst, quickly realising he's being ungrateful and explaining his dismay that we've killrd Brem.

DoubtingArtist_28.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_28.text: He might've let me go, for the right amount of coin. The rest? They'll only be swayed by steel.
DoubtingArtist_28.context: NodeContext: Hinting to us that we'll need to kill the Zhent to free him.

DoubtingArtist_47.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_47.text: You! The way you handled Zarys - you're not one of her thugs.
DoubtingArtist_47.context: InternalNodeContext: Peacefull situation, the artist is still captive, first meeting with the player.NodeContext: Hushed tone, trying to be subtle

DoubtingArtist_171.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_171.context: NodeContext: Deadly serious, with full intent - he feels no need to explain

DoubtingArtist_112.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_112.text: I am not some lower city coinlad offering you a tumble. I am an artist.

DoubtingArtist_71.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_71.text: And my patron will reward you for my rescue - tenfold whatever ransom you pay, I guarantee it.
DoubtingArtist_71.context: NodeContext: Hammering home the point that we'd be foolish not to help him

DoubtingArtist_174.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_174.text: Then it is well I am asking you to serve only yourself.
DoubtingArtist_174.context: NodeContext: Annoyed by our assumption that he was a servant, but steering us back on topic

DoubtingArtist_168.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_168.text: Sure - how much do you cost?

DoubtingArtist_11.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_11.text: You were... rather quick to agree. But all the wiser for it.
DoubtingArtist_11.context: NodeContext: He's just begged us to buy him but blinks and hesitates at how quickly we said yes. Regains his composure and fake warmth in second sentence

DoubtingArtist_170.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_170.text: For the return of her prize artist, my patron will measure her gratitude in gold.
DoubtingArtist_170.context: NodeContext: describing something of great value to someone he believes easily duped

DoubtingArtist_123.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_123.text: Tenfold whatever ransom these clods try to squeeze from you, I guarantee it.

DoubtingArtist_38.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_38.text: As far as you're concerned she may as well be the Coinmaiden herself.
DoubtingArtist_38.context: NodeContext: Arrogant, brushing away our concerns of his patron's means

DoubtingArtist_49.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_49.text: But there will be time for questions later. Please, speak to Brem - I need to see the sun again.
DoubtingArtist_49.context: NodeContext: Steering us back on topic, feeling very sorry for himself

DoubtingArtist_183.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_183.text: I'll see how much they're asking for you.

DoubtingArtist_181.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_181.text: I hope you have means - these Zhent have seen my work. They won't let me go cheaply.
DoubtingArtist_181.context: NodeContext: Sizing us up - he knows he's valuable and we don't look like we can afford him - but are his only hope

DoubtingArtist_157.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_157.text: Please, speak to Brem. I need to see the sun again.
DoubtingArtist_157.context: NodeContext: Steering us back on topic, feeling very sorry for himself

DoubtingArtist_68.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_68.text: Forget it. I just want you to paint my portrait.

DoubtingArtist_143.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_143.context: NodeContext: Losing his patience for a moment - 'stlarn' is a DnD equivalent of 'fuck/fucking'

DoubtingArtist_189.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_189.text: Forgive me, but I can't think down here. Can't work. Free me, and you will have your portrait.
DoubtingArtist_189.context: NodeContext: Regaining his composure, explaining away his ambush and trying to be nice

DoubtingArtist_14.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_14.text: One so grand that even blind Tyr himself will weep to see it - but first, speak to Brem. Please.

DoubtingArtist_138.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_138.text: I doubt you're worth the asking price.

DoubtingArtist_87.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_87.text: Fine - as well as a mere fortune, I will offer you something far greater: a painting by my own hand.
DoubtingArtist_87.context: NodeContext: Maintaing his patience at the fact that a huge reward in gold was apparently not enough for us

DoubtingArtist_135.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_135.text: I'll make of you a portrait so grand that even blind Tyr will weep in its very presence.
DoubtingArtist_135.context: NodeContext: Earnest, promising that we'll get exactly what we want 'Tyr' = TEAR, god of justice

DoubtingArtist_56.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_56.text: Just as soon as I'm back in the city. Please, speak to Brem - I need to see the sun again.

DoubtingArtist_104.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_104.text: This ransom is your patron's problem - not mine.

DoubtingArtist_55.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_55.text: And when my corpse is being picked at by dogs, I suppose it won't be your problem then either?
DoubtingArtist_55.context: NodeContext: Dramatic at how heartless we're being

DoubtingArtist_91.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_91.text: I took you for a better sort than these. Leave me to my chains, then.
DoubtingArtist_91.context: NodeContext: Disgusted with us - he's been arrogant and rude, but how could we turn down helping him

DoubtingArtist_46.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_46.text: Maybe. But you don't look very expensive.

DoubtingArtist_164.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_164.text: Not to you, perhaps - but those of actual taste might disagree.
DoubtingArtist_164.context: NodeContext: Annoyed by our rudeness, returning it in kind

DoubtingArtist_200.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_200.text: Buy you? I'm just here to have my portrait painted.

DoubtingArtist_115.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_115.text: You... oh. Another of Brem's bloody commissions? I will not sully my brush with every ugly vagrant who -
DoubtingArtist_115.context: NodeContext: Initially confused, then realising - his captor has sent us over to have him paint our likeness. He has no interest and considers it a waste of his talent

DoubtingArtist_93.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_93.text: Forgive me, I just... I'm here against my will, you see? But I know my patron is looking.
DoubtingArtist_93.context: NodeContext: Trying to rein in his temper - surely we'll see sense if he explains his predicament

DoubtingArtist_182.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_182.text: She will be most grateful to whoever can secure my release. And most generous, I know it.
DoubtingArtist_182.context: NodeContext: Wink wink nod nod - we have the means to make money and powerful friends here

DoubtingArtist_84.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_84.text: Gods above - I said buy me. If you didn't have the coin, you might have just said.
DoubtingArtist_84.context: InternalNodeContext: The player entered the camp peacefully. Then they murdered all the zhents.NodeContext: Taking in a scene of carnage - he asked us to bribe his captors and instead we slaughtered them. Distaste at our methods

DoubtingArtist_66.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_66.text: In any case, I am a slave no longer - and your money troubles are over, rest assured. For you have saved none other than Oskar Fevras.
DoubtingArtist_66.context: NodeContext: As if we should be the ones honoured to meet him

DoubtingArtist_86.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_86.text: I can't say I've ever been bought before - how much did I fetch?
DoubtingArtist_86.context: InternalNodeContext: The artist has been bought by the player to the Zhent. The situation is still supposedly peacefull.NodeContext: Mildly scandalised, conspiratorial

DoubtingArtist_191.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_191.text: No, don't tell me. There is nothing so depressing as learning one's true value.
DoubtingArtist_191.context: NodeContext: Dismissing, moving on - making an astute observation about himself. He's an ass but he's self-aware

DoubtingArtist_94.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_94.text: Well, you should at least know what you've paid for. I am the Oskar Fevras, at your service.
DoubtingArtist_94.context: NodeContext: Mock formality, as if addressing someone who's going to recognise his name

DoubtingArtist_82.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_82.text: An affliction for which you cannot be faulted, this far from civilisation.

DoubtingArtist_152.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_152.text: But my patron will be most grateful for your heroics. My betrothed, I should say.
DoubtingArtist_152.context: NodeContext: Promising great reward. The second line is almost as if he's unpleasantly reminding himself that he's engaged. He does love this woman, but she's overbearing

DoubtingArtist_179.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_179.text: A genuine pleasure. I'm in your debt - as is my patron. My betrothed, I should say.
DoubtingArtist_179.context: NodeContext: Warm. He's over the top, but being quite sincere here.

DoubtingArtist_18.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_18.text: Assuming Lady Jannath still wishes to marry after our little... falling out.
DoubtingArtist_18.context: NodeContext: Wincing, recalling a bitter argument

DoubtingArtist_79.speaker: Narrator
DoubtingArtist_79.text: *You recall a recent scandal - a patriar of Baldur's Gate who wished to marry a commoner.*

DoubtingArtist_1.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_1.text: I did not run away - a date was never set. There were... complications.
DoubtingArtist_1.context: NodeContext: Indignant, an accusation that's been levelled at him before

DoubtingArtist_7.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_7.text: Before my fame, my patron, there was... another woman. One I planned to spend my life with.
DoubtingArtist_7.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, reflective - he's thinking back on a time when he was poor and anonymous, but happy in a humble life with a woman he loved

DoubtingArtist_133.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_133.text: But when Lady Jannath offered me a future, well... it felt only right to mention my past.
DoubtingArtist_133.context: NodeContext: Rueful - in a fit of stupidity he did the right thing

DoubtingArtist_118.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_118.text: Right, but unwise. I was forced to retreat into the countryside. To paint, and clear my head. To choose, I suppose.
DoubtingArtist_118.context: NodeContext: Rueful - in a fit of stupidity he did the right thing

DoubtingArtist_111.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_111.text: And what choice did you make?

DoubtingArtist_202.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_202.text: Assuming Lady Jannath still wishes to marry after our little... falling out.
DoubtingArtist_202.context: NodeContext: Wincing, recalling a bitter argument

DoubtingArtist_88.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_88.text: She offered me a future, and so in a fit of madness I told her of my past.
DoubtingArtist_88.context: NodeContext: Rueful - in a fit of stupidity he did the right thing

DoubtingArtist_89.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_89.text: Of the woman I'd loved before she found me. Love still, in truth. She was... less than pleased.
DoubtingArtist_89.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, reflective - he's thinking back on a time when he was poor and anonymous, but happy in a humble life with a woman he loved

DoubtingArtist_98.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_98.text: A noblewoman of passion, refinement and, as it turns out, quite ferocious temper.
DoubtingArtist_98.context: NodeContext: Listing admirable qualities of the noblewoman to whom he is engaged

DoubtingArtist_65.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_65.text: The latter I learned only after the engagement, when I told her I was in love with someone else.
DoubtingArtist_65.context: NodeContext: Rueful - in a fit of stupidity he did the right thing

DoubtingArtist_20.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_20.text: I made a timely retreat into the countryside. To paint, and clear my head. To choose, I suppose.

DoubtingArtist_148.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_148.text: Indeed - one to split the very soul. But I dare not dwell on it any longer lest I weep.
DoubtingArtist_148.context: NodeContext: Knows he's being mocked but continues on sincerely nonetheless

DoubtingArtist_99.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_99.text: And we have your reward to consider - once I have made my way safely back to the city.
DoubtingArtist_99.context: NodeContext: Allowing himself to be steered back on topic, firmly assuring us he needs to get back safely before we can be paid

DoubtingArtist_162.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_162.text: I saw your paintings - were they portraits of the women you spoke of?

DoubtingArtist_169.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_169.text: Indeed. I thought the canvas would make clear what my heart could not.
DoubtingArtist_169.context: NodeContext: Fake humble - he knows his paintings are good, and assumes we're a fan too

DoubtingArtist_27.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_27.text: Both turned out masterpieces, more's the pity. Not a stray brushstroke between them.
DoubtingArtist_27.context: NodeContext: Bitter at his own incredible talent - how unlucky for him

DoubtingArtist_154.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_154.text: They're yours, if you can find use for them - in the privy perhaps. I had best get moving.

DoubtingArtist_144.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_144.text: Then I congratulate you - tear them up and they'll be most useful in the privy.

DoubtingArtist_62.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_62.text: I thought the canvas would make clear what my heart could not. Drivel.

DoubtingArtist_80.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_80.text: Now, if you cared to spare some coins in exchange, well. That would ease the discomforts of the road some.

DoubtingArtist_41.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_41.text: I hope you came to a decision - the paintings are gone.

DoubtingArtist_158.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_158.text: Wadded up to wipe Zhentish arses, I expect - and good riddance.

DoubtingArtist_22.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_22.text: Their objective perfection is what caught these bastards' eyes to begin with. Now that I'm free...

DoubtingArtist_24.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_24.text: Say - I don't suppose you could spare some coin, could you? Ease the discomforts of the road some?
DoubtingArtist_24.context: NodeContext: Chancing his arm = we've already gone to great lengths to help him, but he accepts this as rtreatment befitting someone of his station

DoubtingArtist_57.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_57.text: No coin? Mightily imprudent of you.
DoubtingArtist_57.context: NodeContext: Aghast - how could we be so irresponsible? Never mind the fact that we've just paid all our money to free him in the first place

DoubtingArtist_173.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_173.text: A hero to the hilt. Seek me out in the city, truly - beneath my brush, you'll live forever.
DoubtingArtist_173.context: NodeContext: Complimentary, grateful for our help but also asking as if he never expected anything else.

DoubtingArtist_19.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_19.context: NodeContext: Wamly, as if genuinely looking forward to it. Cheerful

DoubtingArtist_113.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_113.text: I've already spent enough coin on you.

DoubtingArtist_108.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_108.text: Coin will just weigh you down. Get moving.

DoubtingArtist_127.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_127.text: I suppose I can endure the walk sober. Suffering has become an old friend, after all.
DoubtingArtist_127.context: NodeContext: Somewhat put out - the burdens he must carry

DoubtingArtist_153.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_153.text: I'll give you a serious discomfort to deal with if you don't get going. Now.

DoubtingArtist_83.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_83.text: Right you are, just asking for a little help was all...
DoubtingArtist_83.context: NodeContext: Immediately retreating from the slightest sign of temper

DoubtingArtist_178.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_178.context: NodeContext: Done with us and keen to move on - yes we've saved him and he is very grateful, but he has things to be doing

DoubtingArtist_32.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_32.text: I must know how this tragic tale ends. What option did you choose?

DoubtingArtist_60.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_60.text: Hm? Oh, absolutely none. Fame and wealth suit me very well, no doubt.
DoubtingArtist_60.context: NodeContext: As if we've asked a question he hadn't considered - then very casually saying he's come to no decision at all

DoubtingArtist_122.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_122.text: And yet I think of that first love, and... I hesitate. Likely I'm going mad.
DoubtingArtist_122.context: NodeContext: Honestly reflective, quietly laughing at himself - he's being offered fame and riches, and he finds himself hesitating for reasons he can't even explain

DoubtingArtist_190.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_190.text: Regardless! We have more immediate concerns - your reward once I've returned to the city, for one.
DoubtingArtist_190.context: NodeContext: Pulling himself out of reverie, briskly back to business

DoubtingArtist_51.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_51.text: All I care about is getting paid.

DoubtingArtist_117.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_117.text: I wish I could harden my heart so. Still, you're right - we have the matter of my return to consider.
DoubtingArtist_117.context: NodeContext: Chiding, as if we're heartless for not caring about his predicament - but moving quickly back to business

DoubtingArtist_61.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_61.text: I don't care about your love life - I just want my reward.

DoubtingArtist_155.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_155.text: Ah. Right. Suit yourself - find me in the city and you shall have your reward.
DoubtingArtist_155.context: NodeContext: He had been ready to tell us the grand drama of his life, assuming we'd want to hear - and is somewhat taken aback when we cut him off

DoubtingArtist_4.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_4.text: Say - you couldn't spare a little coin, could you? Ease the discomforts of the road some?
DoubtingArtist_4.context: NodeContext: Deep down knows he's chancing his arm, but framing it as a reasonable request

DoubtingArtist_132.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_132.text: Ah, patrons dallying with their dashing artisans. A tale as old as art itself.

DoubtingArtist_166.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_166.text: Quite. It seems we are destined to doomed romances, are we not?

DoubtingArtist_106.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_106.text: My slaves do not speak until they are spoken to.

DoubtingArtist_149.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_149.text: Ha! Quite. Well, now that... wait, you're not serious?

DoubtingArtist_29.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_29.text: I don't make jokes with my slaves.

DoubtingArtist_74.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_74.text: Indeed. I'll just... carry your things then, shall I? Scrub your boots? Just one moment.

DoubtingArtist_16.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_16.text: You can SHOVE your boots where even Lathander can't light - I'm no one's slave!

DoubtingArtist_192.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_192.text: Of course I'm not. Just teasing.

DoubtingArtist_77.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_77.text: Droll. Fear not, I'll ensure you're compensated once I return to my patron. My betrothed, I should say.

DoubtingArtist_136.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_136.text: Excellent. When will I get my reward?

DoubtingArtist_48.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_48.text: Fear not, friend! My patron will make good on all my debts. My betrothed, I should say.

DoubtingArtist_25.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_25.text: Don't worry, 'the Oskar Fevras' didn't cost me a single coin.

DoubtingArtist_63.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_63.text: ... do you know, of all the indignities heaped upon me in this place, that might well be the worst.
DoubtingArtist_63.context: NodeContext: Air of tragic self-pity: after being taken as a hostage, he wasn't even ransomed for a proper price

DoubtingArtist_0.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_0.text: It seems you've made quite the profit. My patron will see you rewarded - my betrothed, I should say.
DoubtingArtist_0.context: NodeContext: Brisk, back to matter at hand

DoubtingArtist_159.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_159.text: What will you do with your freedom?

DoubtingArtist_31.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_31.text: Oh - run crying back to my patron I expect. My betrothed, I should say.

DoubtingArtist_92.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_92.text: Oh, my friend. There are far more interesting folk to speak to here.
DoubtingArtist_92.context: NodeContext: Polite but panicked - he's a hostage and by talking to him, we risk making his captors angry

DoubtingArtist_124.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_124.text: You! Zarys may have welcomed you, but I can see you're not one of her thugs.
DoubtingArtist_124.context: InternalNodeContext: Peacefull situation, the artist is still captive, first meeting with the player.NodeContext: Hushed tone, trying to be subtle

DoubtingArtist_125.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_125.text: Excuse me, but I really am far too busy.

DoubtingArtist_197.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_197.context: NodeContext: Smiling throught terror. Second line emphatic

DoubtingArtist_139.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_139.text: Wait, WAIT! I'm just a prisoner - spare me and there'll be coin, I swear it!
DoubtingArtist_139.context: InternalNodeContext: The player entered the camp peacefully. Then they murdered all the zhents.NodeContext: Panicked, he just saw us kill a lot of people and thinks we're about to kill him

DoubtingArtist_15.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_15.text: I'm an artist. These faithless bastards were trying to ransom me back to my patron.
DoubtingArtist_15.context: NodeContext: Relating his story, trying to get it out

DoubtingArtist_120.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_120.text: She's a woman of great means - and great generosity to those who serve her well.
DoubtingArtist_120.context: NodeContext: Warming to the task now that we're listening - he's in control

DoubtingArtist_44.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_44.text: Heroes who rescue her prize painter, for example. Oskar Fevras, at your service.
DoubtingArtist_44.context: NodeContext: As if we should be honoured

DoubtingArtist_147.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_147.text: Oh, thank the gods - if it's wealth you seek then you've done yourself a great service, friend.
DoubtingArtist_147.context: NodeContext: Relieved - he thought we were going to kill him, but now that he knows we can be bought he's in control again

DoubtingArtist_39.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_39.text: Oh, thank the gods. You may not know it, friend, but you've just done yourself a great service indeed.
DoubtingArtist_39.context: NodeContext: Relieved - he thought we were going to kill him, but now that he knows we can be bought he's in control again

DoubtingArtist_134.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_134.text: For you've rescued none other than the artist Oskar Fevras.

DoubtingArtist_145.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_145.text: I can't say I've ever been bought before - how much did I fetch?
DoubtingArtist_145.context: InternalNodeContext: The artist has been bought by the player to the Zhent. The situation is still supposedly peacefull.NodeContext: Mildly scandalised, conspiratorial

DoubtingArtist_180.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_180.text: What - come to kill me yourself? You might as well.
DoubtingArtist_180.context: InternalNodeContext: Peacefull situation, the artist is still captive, already met the playerNodeContext: Intense, eager - waiting for us to tell him he's free

DoubtingArtist_114.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_114.text: Relax - I'll speak to your captors.

DoubtingArtist_188.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_188.text: Now I don't mean to hurry you - but if you could hurry, I'd be most obliged.

DoubtingArtist_186.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_186.context: NodeContext: Aghast - he joked about us killing him and we took it seriously

DoubtingArtist_8.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_8.context: NodeContext: Realising we might be dangerous psycopaths, moderating his tone to politeness. 'No thank you I would not like you to kill me.'

DoubtingArtist_196.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_196.text: You've spoken to Brem? He'll let me go free?
DoubtingArtist_196.context: InternalNodeContext: Peacefull situation, the artist is still captive, already met the playerNodeContext: Intense, eager - waiting for us to tell him he's free

DoubtingArtist_201.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_201.text: I've got enough problems without adding you to the list.

DoubtingArtist_64.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist_64.text: Not yet. I'm working on it.

DoubtingArtist_53.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_53.text: Of course. I don't mean to rush you.

DoubtingArtist_199.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_199.text: I'm sure we have plenty of time before they work me to death.
DoubtingArtist_199.context: NodeContext: Dramatic and passive aggressive - it's just his precious life in the balance

Zhent02_AD_Stage2_0.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Stage2_0.context: NodeContext: A barked order to her men - but not rattled, she's a consummate soldier

Zhent01_0.speaker: Salazon
Zhent01_0.text: You're a friend of the family now. Just as well I didn't blow you up, eh?
Zhent01_0.context: NodeContext: Chummy - he was ready to kill you just a few moments before but knows you're an ally now.

Zhent01_1.speaker: Salazon
Zhent01_1.context: NodeContext: Sheepish - he tried to blow you up a minute before, but knows you're a friend now and is glad you survived

Zhent01_2.speaker: Salazon
Zhent01_2.text: Apologies for, er, trying to kill you before.
Zhent01_2.context: NodeContext: Sheepish - he tried to blow you up a minute before, but knows you're a friend now and is glad you survived

Zhent01_3.speaker: Salazon
Zhent01_3.text: Step lightly - we rigged enough smokepowder to blow this place sky-high. Fist won't find a thing.
Zhent01_3.context: NodeContext: 'Fist' refers to a mercenary faction known as the Flaming Fist.

Zhent01_4.speaker: Salazon
Zhent01_4.text: I'd be about your business swiftly. We've rigged this place to blow at a moment's notice.
Zhent01_4.context: NodeContext: Giving you advice - he's their demolitions expert and he's anticipating the carnage they're about to cause.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_OllyDead_0.speaker: Zarys
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_OllyDead_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Only plays if Olly is dead and all speakers are available.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_OllyDead_4.speaker: Rugan
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_OllyDead_4.text: Painfully. I don't want to talk about it.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_OllyDead_1.speaker: Zarys
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_OllyDead_1.text: When we set off, I want you at the front of the convoy.
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_OllyDead_1.context: InternalNodeContext: Only plays if Olly is dead and all speakers are available.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_OllyDead_5.speaker: Rugan
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_OllyDead_5.text: No thank you. I'm a rear-guard man, always have been.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_OllyDead_2.speaker: Zarys
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_OllyDead_2.text: If we leave you behind,  is that rear enough?

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_OllyDead_3.speaker: Rugan
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_OllyDead_3.text: You drive a hard bargain. The middle it is.

DoubtingArtist_AD_WarnAboutExplosives_0.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_AD_WarnAboutExplosives_0.text: Wait! They've got oil everywhere - and bloody torches!

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_3.speaker: Olly
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_3.text: I'm sick of hiding down in the dark. This ain't why I joined the Zahent!
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Only plays if Olly is alive and all speakers are available.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_6.speaker: Rugan
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_6.text: It's pronounced 'Zent', lad. The H is silent.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_10.speaker: Olly
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_10.text: I don't care. I want out of this damn cave.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_5.speaker: Rugan
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_5.text: The doggies nearly got me this time. It was close.
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_5.context: InternalNodeContext: Only plays if all speakers are available and present.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_0.speaker: Rugan
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_0.text: Lass, if you hate me that much, hire someone to kill me.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_7.speaker: Rugan
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_7.text: I'm told we're taking a stroll through the Underdark once we blow the charges.
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_7.context: InternalNodeContext: Only plays if all speakers are available and present.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_17.speaker: Zarys
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_17.text: Let me guess. You'd rather take the surface.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_12.speaker: Rugan
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_12.text: The route with fewer hook horrors and other beasties? Perish the thought.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_16.speaker: Zarys
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_16.text: How did a coward like you survive all these years in the Network?

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_13.speaker: Olly
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_13.text: You lot are always making fun of me.
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_13.context: InternalNodeContext: Only plays if Olly is alive and all speakers are available.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_2.speaker: Rugan
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_2.text: Oh, lad. That just shows we care!

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_9.speaker: Zarys
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_9.text: I do it because it makes me hate him less.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_15.speaker: Rugan
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_15.text: I'm told we're taking a stroll through the Underdark once we blow the charges.
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents_15.context: InternalNodeContext: Only plays if all speakers are available and present.

Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed_0.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed_0.text: A little bit of this will turn your blood to treacle.
Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed_0.context: NodeContext: During combat, character is coating their weapon in poison.

Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics_0.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics_0.text: Don't just paint faces. People got other parts, too.

Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics_1.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics_1.text: You should change that. People don't make that face in real life.

Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics_2.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics_2.text: Get it right, or I'll make a brush out of your eyebrows.

VB_Entrance_0.speaker: Player
VB_Entrance_0.text: A cave beneath the tavern. I wonder how deep it runs...

Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed_0.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed_0.text: Let's see how you like a little rot.
Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed_0.context: NodeContext: During combat, character is coating their weapon with poison.

Zhent06_AD_1.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06_AD_1.text: Gonna take Bellar for all he's worth. Soon as I win my dice back from him...

Zhent06_AD_2.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06_AD_2.text: Another damn day in this cave.

Zhent06_AD_3.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06_AD_3.text: Down into the Underdark. Reckon I'll be old by the time I see the sun again.

Zhent06_AD_4.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06_AD_4.text: This cut... does not smell right...
Zhent06_AD_4.context: NodeContext: Bored, picking/sniffing at a cut on his arm as he stands guard.

Dog_03_0.speaker: Istor
Dog_03_0.text: Careful! No stone-scent. No stone-sound. Strange-stone here.

Dog_03_2.speaker: Istor
Dog_03_2.text: I do not understand. But I will guard this nothing-stone.

Zhent03_28.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_28.text: Something I can help you with?

Zhent03_48.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_48.text: Well now! If we're talking, my guess is you've got coin to spend.

Zhent03_44.speaker: Player
Zhent03_44.text: I'm here to buy your prisoner.

Zhent03_58.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_58.text: I doubt you've got that kinda dosh lying about. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Zhent03_19.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_19.text: He's all yours. Don't forget to feed him - he bawls something proper.

Zhent03_16.speaker: Player
Zhent03_16.text: I don't have that kind of money.

Zhent03_99.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_99.text: Been there, mate. Come back when you've coin, and we can talk, eh?

Zhent03_110.speaker: Player
Zhent03_110.text: You're insane if you think I'm going to pay that much.

Zhent03_80.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_80.text: All right, so maybe I was fishing. No fooling you. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

Zhent03_63.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_63.text:
Aye, off my rocker me - so you'd best not push me too far, eh? Price is the price. 
([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Zhent03_93.speaker: Player
Zhent03_93.text: I don't have that much gold. I have plenty of steel, though.

Zhent03_6.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_6.text: All right mate, all right. Waukeen's clipped coins, there's no need to get arsey.

Zhent03_75.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_75.text: Go on then. But anything lower would be criminal. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

Zhent03_3.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_3.text: Oh? More steel than the entire Zhentarim? Cos that's who you're crossing if you try to scab me on a deal.

Zhent03_42.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_42.text: The price is the price. Pay up or get lost.

Zhent03_40.speaker: Player
Zhent03_40.text: Too much. Cut your price down to size or I'll cut you down to size.

Zhent03_9.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_9.text: Then what? You going to kill the entire Zhentarim next? Good luck, prick.

Zhent03_53.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_53.text: Then it's the same price I gave you before. No more haggling. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

Zhent03_104.speaker: Player
Zhent03_104.text: I don't have that kind of money.

Zhent03_94.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_94.text: Well don't you cut a fine figure. Want your portrait done?

Zhent03_26.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_26.text: If you have the gold, my pet artist will make you a most heroical likeness.

Zhent03_47.speaker: Player
Zhent03_47.text: It's not the art I want to buy - it's the artist.

Zhent03_32.speaker: Player
Zhent03_32.text: He's not a pet, he's a prisoner - let him go.

Zhent03_60.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_60.text: Let's say we're his patrons, yeah? Found him wandering the wilds alone.

Zhent03_101.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_101.text: He needs protection. And if his paintings cover our costs - so much the better, eh?

Zhent03_100.speaker: Player
Zhent03_100.text: 'Protection'. It sounds a bit more like kidnapping.

Zhent03_31.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_31.text: You looking to buy him? I'm open to offers, mate. Threats, not so much.

Zhent03_89.speaker: Player
Zhent03_89.text: Fine, I'll buy him. How much?

Zhent03_96.speaker: Player
Zhent03_96.text: We can skip threats and go straight to blades, if you like.

Zhent03_10.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_10.text: All right mate, all right - no need to get arsey about it.

Zhent03_66.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_66.text: Look, mate - this don't have to get violent, right? You want him, pay for him.

Zhent03_54.speaker: Player
Zhent03_54.text: If he's as talented as you say, someone will be looking for him.

Zhent03_7.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_7.text: These artsy tossers always have friends in high places. That's why they're valuable.

Zhent03_1.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_1.text: But... aye. Might be we've drawn enough attention to this place.

Zhent03_12.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_12.text: Take the moany bastard, if he means that much to ya. Doubt his crap would sell anyway.

Zhent03_56.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_56.text: I expect so. And whoever wants him had best bring a heap of coin.

Zhent03_111.speaker: Player
Zhent03_111.text: Here's my offer: give me your slave, or become mine.

Zhent03_35.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_35.text: Hey - I was just looking to make a little coin. Ain't after a mess.

Zhent03_8.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_8.text: Counter-offer. Come back with coin, and I'll pretend you're as scary as you think you are.

Zhent03_30.speaker: Player
Zhent03_30.text: Art's more valuable once the creator is dead. I can arrange that.

Zhent03_82.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_82.text: What, kill him and the price of his drawings goes up? Bloody clever, that.

Zhent03_29.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_29.text: Go on, then - but don't kill him here. He's going to be a bleater, I know it.

Zhent03_103.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_103.text: What, reckon I can't deal with him myself? It's not a bad idea, mind...

Zhent03_2.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_2.text: But we've gabbed enough. You got something to trade or what?

Zhent03_114.speaker: Player
Zhent03_114.text: If this artist were to tragically expire, his portfolio would become finite - therefore priceless.

Zhent03_77.speaker: Player
Zhent03_77.text: Slavekeeping's bad for business with any halfway-moral customer. Let him go.

Zhent03_90.speaker: Player
Zhent03_90.text: Forget the artist - do you have anything else to trade?

Zhent03_5.speaker: Player
Zhent03_5.text: Sounds fair. I'll take a portrait, then.

Zhent03_76.speaker: Player
Zhent03_76.text: Do you have anything else to trade?

Zhent03_106.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_106.text: Of course. Got some interesting stock for a friend of the family.

Zhent03_51.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_51.text: Plenty, if the finer things don't appeal.

Zhent03_33.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_33.text: Can't show you the good stuff 'til Zarys gives the say-so, mind. Friends of the Zhent only.

Zhent03_22.speaker: Player
Zhent03_22.text: I do cut a fine figure. I'll take one.

Zhent03_57.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_57.text: You've got an eye for quality. Every noble in Baldur's Gate will be after one of these.

Zhent03_61.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_61.text: Tell him I sent you - and if he stains it up with his sniffling, there'll be hell to pay.

Zhent03_13.speaker: Player
Zhent03_13.text: No, thanks - I just want to trade.

Zhent03_71.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_71.text: If you have the gold, my pet artist will make you a most heroical likeness. Follow the whining.

Zhent03_108.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_108.text: Something I can help you with?

Zhent07_AD_Combat_0.speaker: Vol
Zhent07_AD_Combat_0.text: We've buried tougher than you. Come on!
Zhent07_AD_Combat_0.context: NodeContext: A threat shouted during combat.

Zhent06_AD_Combat_0.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06_AD_Combat_0.text: You've messed up. At least you won't live to regret it!

Zhent02_3.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_3.text: You're a friend of the Zhent now - that's worth something in Baldur's Gate.
Zhent02_3.context: NodeContext: Wryly amused, sizing us up - we made some powerful friends in helping her.

Zhent02_21.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_21.text: Assuming we make it back there in one piece.
Zhent02_21.context: NodeContext: Sardonic, considering the dangerous path ahead.

Zhent02_7.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_7.text: Yeah? Got business to conduct, so if you ain't helping you can toddle off.
Zhent02_7.context: NodeContext: Disinterested - we refused to take on a job for her and so she has no use for us.

Zhent02_19.speaker: Player
Zhent02_19.text: I've changed my mind. I'll take the job.

Zhent02_17.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_17.text: Looks like we can be friends after all.
Zhent02_17.context: NodeContext: Reassessing us - we've gone from useless to useful in her eyes.

Zhent02_139.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_139.text: Backtrack along the road to the east. They were travelling with a wagon.
Zhent02_139.context: NodeContext: Short, terse - a commander briefing a subordinate who will obey

Zhent02_81.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_81.text: Some of our people are missing - more importantly, so is their cargo. They were in a caravan coming from the east.
Zhent02_81.context: NodeContext: Grim - we're getting to the heart of the matter. She's fairly unflappable but this job is extremely important.

Zhent02_6.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_6.text: Bring them back alive if you can. Failing that, get me that shipment. Unopened.
Zhent02_6.context: NodeContext: Giving orders, conveying grim urgency.

Zhent02_9.speaker: Player
Zhent02_9.text: I have news of your missing people.

Zhent02_67.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_67.context: NodeContext: Expectant - there's no reason for us not to be getting to the point.

Zhent02_65.speaker: Player
Zhent02_65.text: I have news of your missing people.

Zhent02_24.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_24.context: NodeContext: Straight to the point - when last we spoke she gave us a job, and that's all she's interested in.

Zhent02_18.speaker: Player
Zhent02_18.text: I'm afraid they won't coming back.

Zhent02_131.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_131.text: Gods damn it. What about the shipment?
Zhent02_131.context: NodeContext: We've given her bad news, but her mens' lives are secondary to her actual goal - she's most urgent about the shipment

Zhent02_93.speaker: Player
Zhent02_93.context: InternalNodeContext: Only visible if unopened chest is in inventory.

Zhent02_88.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_88.text: Beshaba's black bones, you did it!
Zhent02_88.context: CinematicNodeContext: She takes the chestInternalNodeContext: Player gets rewardNodeContext: Actual surprise and relief - her survival depends on this shipment and we've recovered it.

Zhent02_68.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_68.text: And still sealed? You're a godsdamned wonder. Here's your coin.
Zhent02_68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands over money to player. InternalNodeContext: Chest situation resolved. NodeContext: Checking the box, relieved and impressed that we've finished the job perfectly.

Zhent02_94.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_94.text: Actual professionals are rare - you ever want more work, come see me in the Gate.
Zhent02_94.context: NodeContext: She looks on us as an equal - she usually views those she works with as messy or inferior.

Zhent02_90.speaker: Player
Zhent02_90.context: InternalNodeContext: Only visible if player has opened chest in inventory.

Zhent02_59.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_59.text: Beshaba's black bones, you bloody found it. Funny thing, though - I swear I told you not to open it.
Zhent02_59.context: CinematicNodeContext: Takes the chest, hefts it NodeContext: First half is surprise and relief that we completed a crucial job - second half is her taking on irrevocable edge after realising we've broken the terms of the deal, though - and now she has to kill us.

Zhent02_91.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_91.text: Couldn't you just be a professional? Do as you're told, no questions asked? Like so:
Zhent02_91.context: NodeContext: Grim, frustrated - why can't anyone around her just to their job properly. The 'like so' is her about to order her men to kill us, demonstrating how one follows orders.

Zhent02_101.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_101.context: InternalNodeContext: Starts combat NodeContext: Louder, leads to violence.

Zhent02_23.speaker: Player
Zhent02_23.text: Give her the flask you found inside the chest.

Zhent02_98.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_98.context: NodeContext: Mute, neutral - she's not surprised by much, but opening this shipment means we've killed her and all her men.

Zhent02_100.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_100.text: You've killed me. You've bloody killed us all. Damned if I won't return the favour.
Zhent02_100.context: NodeContext: Beat between sentences. Grim towards the end, deciding she's going to take us down with her.

Zhent02_117.speaker: Player
Zhent02_117.text: I had your cargo, but I lost it.
Zhent02_117.context: InternalNodeContext: Only visible if player had chest or flask in inventory and no longer does.

Zhent02_29.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_29.text: You... lost it. Funny, that - you just lost a heap of coin too.
Zhent02_29.context: NodeContext: Repeating as if she doesn't quite understand. Then emphasising to us just how serious this is, frustrated we've come back looking for a reward for a job we half-assed.

Zhent02_97.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_97.text: Actually, hells with this - the day I've had? You just lost your life too.
Zhent02_97.context: NodeContext: Gives up trying to contain her anger at how badly we've messed up the job.

Zhent02_76.speaker: Player
Zhent02_76.context: InternalNodeContext: Player has never interacted with chest. Enables 14fedd62-c2e7-8d4a-4b01-f5c557cb4f53

Zhent02_56.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_56.text: Good. Reckon you won't find it here, though.
Zhent02_56.context: NodeContext: Blunt, disinterested - if we haven't found what she needs, she's not interested.

Zhent02_99.speaker: Player
Zhent02_99.text: I saved them. They'll be along soon.

Zhent02_130.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_130.text: Then I'm much obliged - or I will be, once I see them and their cargo.
Zhent02_130.context: NodeContext: Neutral - not unfriendly but we're telling her something too good to be true and until she sees evidence she's not interested in dealing with us

Zhent02_28.speaker: Player
Zhent02_28.text: I saved Rugan. He'll be along soon.

Zhent02_115.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_115.text: Then I'm in your debt - or will be, once I see him and his cargo.
Zhent02_115.context: NodeContext: Neutral - not unfriendly but we're telling her something too good to be true and until she sees evidence she's not interested in dealing with us

Zhent02_66.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_66.text: Didn't think you'd get your coin based on spinning some tale, did you?
Zhent02_66.context: NodeContext: Vaguely chiding - we told her we'd do a job, and she's not going to be giviing us a penny until we complete it.

Zhent02_37.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_37.text: Well I'll give you a hint, shall I? They ain't down here. On your way.

Zhent02_34.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_34.text: I was glad to see Rugan, until he told me he lost the shipment.

Zhent02_30.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_30.text: Failure creates debt. And debt requires payment. But he'll live.

Zhent02_44.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_44.text: Welcome to the family. Don't get comfortable - that shipment's wanted in Baldur's Gate.
Zhent02_44.context: NodeContext: Wry, vaguely amused, considering us - we impressed her enough that she recruited us instead of killing us, but we still have a job to do.

Zhent02_45.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_45.text: Not many can talk their way into a Zhentarim outpost.

Zhent02_128.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_128.text: I could use someone with your skills. Interested in a job?
Zhent02_128.context: NodeContext: Making an offer, feeling us out

Zhent02_127.speaker: Player
Zhent02_127.text: I'd rather know who I'd be working for first - the Zhentarim?

Zhent02_89.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_89.text: We're the finest mercenaries on the Coast.
Zhent02_89.context: NodeContext: Not a boast - just a simple statement of fact.

Zhent02_129.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_129.text: We can provide you with anything - for a price.
Zhent02_129.context: NodeContext: Again, not boastful - just a statement of fact. They're merchants who have no scruples about what they sell or who to.

Zhent02_132.speaker: Player
Zhent02_132.text: Wait, so what are you: merchants or mercenaries?

Zhent02_46.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_46.text: If you've got coin to spend and problems to solve, the Zhent will relieve you of both.
Zhent02_46.context: NodeContext: Stating it simply - her group are mercenaries, there's nothing complicated about it

Zhent02_57.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_57.text: But today I'm offering work, not looking for it.
Zhent02_57.context: NodeContext: Bringing us back to the topic at hand, no longer interested in indulging our curiosity

Zhent02_113.speaker: Player
Zhent02_113.text: Doesn't sound like a group I want to get involved with.

Zhent02_140.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_140.text: It's gold I'm offering, not a marriage bond.
Zhent02_140.context: NodeContext: Scornful of our moral objections - she's offering us a simple job

Zhent02_62.speaker: Player
Zhent02_62.text: Lot of explosives. Planning a war?

Zhent02_138.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_138.text: Cleaning up. We had a steady operation going here.
Zhent02_138.context: NodeContext: Speaking about something distasteful - their operation was running smoothly until another organisation ruined it for them.

Zhent02_20.speaker: Zarys
